Reviews.Title: “trip to amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: kerstin b Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The service was very good and the people were very friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel is excellent and you were in nearly 10 minutes by feet in the city that was great. The room was ok, the bathroom was clear but we don't have a own toilette in the room, that was not so great but ok for the 4 days that we stayed in this hotel. But all in all it is a great hotel and we would like to stay again in the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Its ok, but not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: 117hdesai
Reviews.Content: 3 nights at this hotel, which is more like a shabby B&B. You have to walk up very steep staircase at each level, we had a top floor room with a shower, no toilet they are all shared, our room had a balcony, which was one of the nicest parts of the room, otherwise the bed was small, terrible room colour and not a great smell when we first walked in. Breakfast time was a nightmare, 1st morning we got pushed back till after 9am, 2nd morning we got told we are to late and were asked to go to our room with our breakfast, we refused and sat in the room with our few pieces of bread and some jams, not a good breakfast service at all. 3rd morning we were not even greeted well but enjoyed the breakfast. The staff who run the hotel seem to be either friends or family, not sure, the first man was ok but they insist you pay when you get there and not after as you leave, the other guy was very nice and helpful, the breakfast guy, was terrible and was not interested in anyone. would probably not stay here again, shame really as its in a great location and thats what we were looking for.

Reviews.Title: “sort of ok..for 1 night”
Reviews.Author: zeeds_shimla_india
Reviews.Content: my family stayed for one night only...good things are central location for all sight seeing places in AMSTERDAM ,very near to central railway station and there is near by taxi stand from where u can get a taxi any time,few bad points ,very steep stairs to climb ,rooms are not so worth as per their price ,thanks to our location of room we had a toilet in front of room but a common one,room was not ready when reached at around 3..book only if u have to stay for one night and that too in urgency...

Reviews.Title: “The worst place in Amsterdam I have stayed in, but not catastrophic”
Reviews.Author: hawkinspete
Reviews.Content: I booked Hotel Galerij after reading the largely negative reviews, on the basis it was cheapest (on Expedia) at the time and I just needed somewhere to crash. The place looked cleaner than I was expecting - no noticable body-fluid stains on the carpet or walls, and the bedding, towels looked OK.. Certainly not luxurious in any way, and lacked hotel basics like TV. The infamous stairs are a daunting sight and not for travellers with much luggage. There were some 80 year-olds staying at same time as me and they managed to the make it to the top floor OK so stairs look worse than they are. The place is very noisy - sounds of other guests were disturbing, and the church bells seemed to ring every 30 minutes 24x7. Bring ear-plugs and you'll be OK. I didn't have any... Although the place *looks* clean, I woke up scratching and left with multiple insect bites. Bed bugs or some other nasties I guess. The staff were friendly enough. Shared toilet, bathroom, clean enough. Shower door did not lock. The location is excellent - just off Dam Square. All in all not a pleasant experience but not catastrophic. Fine if you just want to crash for a few nights and have expectations set low in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and you're guaranteed a good nights sleep after you've climbed the stairs!”
Reviews.Author: Jonny_L_Burnside
Reviews.Content: A group of 6 of us stayed at the Galerij for 3 nights a stag party. My friend who booked it got us a good deal on the hotel which didn't cost the earth. We found the hotel to be slightly basic but very clean and comfortable (beds fine with plenty of running hot water for the showers), basically what we were looking for as a base and place to crash at night. Only 2 of us made it up for breakfast one of the days which I understand wasn't up to much (bread and jam) but the excellent Sara's Pancake house was next door and Jennifer's Croissanterie across the road also so we didn't starve! The location of the hotel was ideal, less than 10 minutes walk to Dam Square and 2 mins from the Anne Frank Museum and canal cruise stops. The hotel is on quite a busy thoroughfare, our room was quite warm so we kept the window open at night and were woken by the trams which seemed to start at 5 am and church bells which went on the half hour! We were on the top floor, as other reviewers have said the stairs are a nightmare, the 1st staircase which greets you at the front door which takes you to reception is quite an imposing site! I would certainly stay here again, I wouldn't necessarily take my wife for a romantic break here for for group parties looking a base to explore the city at reasonable cost it was ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job for a weekend away!”
Reviews.Author: BigJim24
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in September 2010, the hotel is brilliant for a weekend away with your mates. Room was clean and bedding was changed every day. Staff were really friendly and welcoming. Price was really good

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the plague”
Reviews.Author: ShaneL79
Reviews.Content: We were here in October and booked three nights. As soon as we arrived we thought it looked rather dingy in the lobby, but once we made it to the room we were absolutely disgusted. Feces stains on the floor, blood stains, and about a dozen other stains I don't even want to think what they are from. These stains looked new and unwashed. The double bed mentioned on hotels.ca was actually two cots with more than half the springs completely missing or broken. The thin mattress was touching the floor and it was dirty. The sheets were dirty, and they had a few large holes. We tried to save a few bucks after a long trip, but I would have rather slept on a park bench in the rain than stay there. We asked reception for a refund, they refused. We asked to speak to the manager or owner, they refused (although we discovered later the guy who was refusing was either the owner or manager). Eventually after piles of emails and calls to hotels.ca we got a full refund for all three nights since the hotels description was not accurate at all. We had to send them pictures. We found another nice hotel for the same price and it was in a nice residential neighbourhood near Leidseplein. Unless you are on an extremely strict budget and have absolutely no standards on where you sleep, I would avoid this place at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “More like hostel than hotel”
Reviews.Author: citybike
Reviews.Content: It is how it is described in the web. Stayed at single room. Small and clean, a bit worn out bed linen. Breakfast just bread and marmalades, even not a toaster... Location is good and renovation is actually going, painting and some refurnishing. Officially one star but in European standard I would make this low standard hotel better lovely hostel and with some en-suites. Service is OK. And the price is key factor. Stairs are sportish it has it own atmosphere

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest”
Reviews.Author: Tlee34
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and they scared me a little but the price was so cheap and after all, it was Amsterdam. I didn't care about the size of the room, just cleanliness and that it wasn't. The room itself was not large but not as small as others in Europe. We were on the top floor and did have to climb all the spiral stairs to the top with luggage but had anticipated this already. It's a canal house afterall so it did make it a bit charming. One of the front desk men was nice, the other a little suspicious. The carpet was absolutely the dirtiest I have ever seen. Stains everywhere, no telling from what exactly. I'm not a picky person generally, a clean room with a bed and a warm shower (which we did have) is usually all it takes to satisfy me and it was almost obtained - but it just wasn't clean. Yes, the staff came in and changed the bed linens and put new towels in the bath and took out the trash, but the mattresses were stained and again, the carpet filthy. The towels didn't smell fresh and the blankets on the bed were never washed - I don't mean while we were staying there but I think quite possibly EVER. I wished we would have spent more money for a cleaner room I'm sorry to say. We did not indulge in the breakfast, but Sara's Pancakes next door was the best thing about this hotel! The location in general was great just wouldn't ever do it again. This was my least favorite hotel in all of Europe. I felt like I needed a shower after the shower, I actually wore flip flops in it. In one word - "ICK"

Reviews.Title: “Does the Job”
Reviews.Author: dinpy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with two friends and we didn't pay very much for the hotel. Just as well we didnt as its basically a B&B masquerading as a hotel. We were on the top floor which meant climbing loads of steep stairs which wasnt enjoyable with baggage but it wasnt the end of the world. The room was a decent enough size with a good shower but the carpet was littered with dubious-looking stains and the bedsheets didnt fit too well. I had the misfortune of sharing the double bed with a mate and the bed was pretty small it must be said, although it wasn't uncomfortable. We didnt sample the inclusive breakfast as we woke up rather late, but we did notice a nasty whiff at the foot of the stairs by the entrance door. In summary, the hotel is pretty grubby and not for those who are after luxury or even budget chain hotel standards. But for a few mates who only washed, changed and slept at the hotel, it fitted the bill adequately without rinsing our wallets. It is without doubt the worst hotel i've stayed in, but you get what you pay for and we really didnt pay much for it so we cant complain.

Reviews.Title: “It left me traumatised”
Reviews.Author: Barneymorton
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as a friend booked the hotel as part of a weekend away. This was the worst 2 nights accommodation of my life, the place was filthy and left me traumatised.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Kym83
Reviews.Content: We were worried about staying at this hotel after reading the previous reviews but have been pleasently surprised by the standard of the hotel!! We stayed in a double room and it was impeccibly clean and serviced everyday. It was also an ensuite room!! The bed was also very comfy!! The staff were friendly and helpful and although we didnt have the breakfast (late nights!!) it smelt lovely every morning!! There are a few stairs to climb as in the other reviews but that is the same everywhere in Amsterdam. The church bells werent loud enough to bother us in our room. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: echollin
Reviews.Content: This hotel isn't the greatest, but it really isn't that bad for the price and location. We had a room with a balcony which was nice. The room itself was rather small and the carpet shows obvious signs of wear. The room did have a shower and a sink and the toilet was close to the room. The bed sheets and towels were changed daily. Like others have have said there are a lot of stairs, we were on the top floor and counted 74 to our room from the front door. When you first get there you will have to be buzzed in and will have to climb what probably is two flights of stairs. Breakfast was boiled eggs and bread with butter, jelly, and peanut butter, not really bad but we skipped it about half the time we were there. The staff was friendly, but I think there were only two of them working 12 hour shifts. They know what room we were in and gave us the right key without us having to ask.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: mcfc32
Reviews.Content: Now i have stayed in some places over the years & having been in the Army cannot be accused of being too fussy. We were there for a bit of a lads weekend & having read some of the previous reviews, thought "well what do you expect for the money" with a smirk. However, with a large bag on my shoulder, I had the door opened for me & the stairs, as mentioned in other reviews, are horrendous. As a fit couple of lads, with our bags, we nearly had a heart attack at the top, especially when we were allocated a top floor room. For a place to kip down with a load of beer in your system, this place is fine, however if you find the smell of cannabis wafting through as sickening as we do, pay the extra & go somewhere that doesn't have 'recreational smokers' in the larger rooms on the floors below.

Reviews.Title: “convenient”
Reviews.Author: anneeLondon
Reviews.Content: Character hotel in good location for all the sights and lovely Jordaan bars/markets. Stairs very steep - typical Amsterdam. Room (shared for 4) was compact and basic but adequate with balcony onto the street. Breakfast not very enticing - bland sliced bread, processed cheese, egg or jams. Friendly 24hr staff.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and adequate”
Reviews.Author: FiBenn
Reviews.Content: Not realising that I was booking a trip around the big annual celebration in Amsterdam, I booked this hotel as a bit of a last resort because there was no room at the other inns! To say I was concerned about our stay after the last review is an understatement but it was booked and off we went. I booked a quadruple room and a single room. My four travel companions shared the quadruple room. It was a little like a school dormitory and it was a bit of a squeeze but as we spent little time at the hotel other than when sleeping and for a short while late afternoon/early evening to get ready for a night on the tiles, it was fine. The single room was compact and a little lacking in furniture but again, it was adequate for the amount of time spent at the hotel. The bedside cabinet was broken but I worked out the knack to open the drawer without the whole thing falling apart pretty easily. Take your own towel because the towels are old and I don't think fabric conditioner has ever been used on them! It may also be an idea to take an extra pillow. The quadruple room had it's own shower, I used a shared shower for the floor but never had to wait for it to be available. The hotel seems to be joined to another one and that allows at least an extra wc on each floor! Of course, it has to be mentioned that the stairs are quite a feat! I certainly felt fitter by the end of our 3 day stay! There aren't TVs in the rooms but it's Amsterdam - get out and do something, there's a million things to do! There was a phone, I don't know if it worked. Breakfast was included in our price but we didn't take it up at any point. It looked like fairly basic stuff so we headed down to Sara's Pancakes which was on the row of shops below the hotel - it's fantastic! Throughly recommend it. It's not the best hotel in Amsterdam but for the price you pay (we paid c. Â£80 for 3 nights) then what can you expect? It was clean enough and the location can't be faulted. Go out, drink Heineken and collapse on your return and you'll be fine!

Reviews.Title: “Next time in Amsterdam, we are going to stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 days and was satisfied with this hotell. Good central position. The location was ideal as a base for walking trips in Amsterdam- right in the centre. The rooms are clean and the people running the place were friendly and helpful. Cleen towels ewery day was a nice suprise. an a simple but god breakfast. We got more than we expected in a hotel at low costs.â€™The stairs are a steep and narrow, but was no problom for us. Next time in Amsterdam, we are going to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value!!”
Reviews.Author: andyh1980
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small but clean and the people running the place were friendly and helpful. The location is ideal - right in the centre - but you are high up enough that you wont hear the street noise. Gotta admit the stairs are a bit of a shock so if you don't like heights its probably wise to take a pass on this place. For the price you pay you will not get anything better.

Reviews.Title: “stay away”
Reviews.Author: Bondo1
Reviews.Content: In my opinion, a hostel looks like a 4 star hotel compared to this experience. Brought as part of a travel package through Europe, first stop - was ready to head back to states after first night. Mattress sheet wrong size - only covered 3/4 of mattress so had to sleep directly on mattress. 17 bug bites first night. When brought to hotel staff attention, they acted like they didn't understand English. Third time in Amsterdam, first time with a language barrier problem. Over 70 stair steps to room - could handle that but was afraid to sit on bed once we got there. Slept in clothes the rest of the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stairs too Steep”
Reviews.Author: Janette from NW England
Reviews.Content: Stairs are first thing you see. Very, very steep and narrow. We all found these daunting. Hotel basic but clean. Good central position near Anne Franks house, Dam Square and Red Light District. We are all female and would not stay here again because of stairs.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Galerij
HotelInfo.Address: Raadhuisstraat 43, Amsterdam 1016 DD, The Netherlands
